action.action-desc: Mr. Jacobs of New York introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to impose a tax on foreign-owned under-utilized residential real property.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the American Property Act.

section.header: Tax on foreign-owned under-utilized residential real property

subsection.text: Chapter 36 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subchapter:

subchapter.header: Tax on foreign-Owned under-Utilized residential real property

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 4491. Tax on foreign-owned under-utilized residential real property.

section.header: Tax on foreign-owned under-utilized residential real property

subsection.text: In the case of any specified foreign person which owns any specified under-utilized residential real property for more than one-half of any taxable year, there is hereby imposed a tax equal to 1 percent of the estimated value of such property.

paragraph.text: The term specified under-utilized residential real property means, with respect to any taxable year, any specified residential property located in the United States which is occupied as a dwelling unit for less than 180 days, as determined pursuant to paragraph (2).

subparagraph.text: Occupancy of specified residential property shall be determined by taking into consideration only such days as fall into a qualifying occupancy period.
The term qualifying occupancy period means a period of at least one month in the taxable year during which a qualifying occupant has continuous occupancy of a dwelling unit.

clause.text: The term qualifying occupant means an individual who is—

subclause.text: the taxpayer, the spouse, parent, or child of such taxpayer, or a tenant, and

item.text: a citizen or permanent resident of the United States, or
authorized to work in the United States.

clause.header: Special rule for taxpayer and spouse
clause.text: In the case of a taxpayer or spouse of such taxpayer, such individual may only be taken into account as a qualifying occupant if the dwelling unit is the primary residence of such individual during the qualifying occupancy period.

paragraph.text: The term specified residential property means a single-family home or structure consisting of four residential units or less, or a part of a building that is a semi-detached house, rowhouse unit, residential condominium unit or other similar premises that is, or is intended to be, a separate parcel or other division of real property, and includes any land which was conveyed with such home, structure, or building.

subsection.text: For purposes of this section, the term estimated value means, with respect to property for any taxable year, the greater of—

paragraph.text: the appraised value of such property for purposes of determining State or local property taxes (determined as of the close of such taxable year), or
the most recent sales price of such property (as so determined).

subsection.text: For purposes of this section, the term specified foreign person means any person other than a United States person.

subsection.header: Special rules for property acquired or transferred during a taxable year

paragraph.text: For purposes of subsection (b)(1), specified under-utilized residential real property shall not be treated as occupied as a dwelling unit with respect to any taxpayer for any day during which the taxpayer did not own such property.
In the case of any specified under-utilized residential real property sold or otherwise transferred by the taxpayer during the taxable year—

subparagraph.text: the amount described in subsection (c)(1) shall be determined as of the last day on which the taxpayer owns such property, and
the amount described in subsection (c)(2) shall be the amount for which such property is so sold or otherwise transferred.

subsection.text: The table of subchapters for chapter 36 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Subchapter E—Tax on foreign-owned under-utilized residential real property

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
